issue.title: [C++] Add support for Libhdfs++
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-2496](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2496). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Libhdfs++ is an asynchronous pure C++ HDFS client. It is now part of the HDFS project. Details are available here.

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HDFS-8707

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2496?focusedCommentId=16448207) by Deepak Majeti (mdeepak):*
CC [~James C], who is one of the main developers of Libhdfs++

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2496?focusedCommentId=16448260) by James Clampffer (James C):*
HDFS-8707 has been merged into hadoop trunk.  I've been holding off on resolving it since I want to finish a few subtasks and haven't wanted to spam the hdfs-dev list by moving them all out into independent tasks.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2496?focusedCommentId=16974181) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Are you still willing to work on this?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2496?focusedCommentId=16974463) by Deepak Majeti (mdeepak):*
Not anytime soon. We are still working on improving the robustness of Libhdfs++.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2496?focusedCommentId=17392901) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
As far as I can tell, libhdfspp still does not seem ready for consumption (it lacks file writing, for example). Closing for now.
